skillTree.localised_description: The finest horses in the Old World, bred for their endurance and fiery temperament, barded for further protection.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit can pass through trees.
This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

skillTree.localised_description: Arrows, cannonballs and more esoteric munitions are needed in endless supply on the battlefield.
Naught can penetrate the swirling mists of ice and sleet that churn around those afforded Father Bear's protection.
This Lord belts out orders and can be heard even across a battlefield smothered in the grim noise of war.
A Kislevite army without vodka is like a bear without teeth and claws.
Our gods stand with us in the battlefield, protecting us from the Dark Powers.

effects.description:
Magic Resistance: +8% for Torch Bearers of Dazh, Sons of ursun, Claws of Ursun, and Hammers of Tor units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: We have endured the attacks of the servants of the Dark Powers for centuries, and we will keep doing it as long as one of us still breaths.

effects.description:
Physical Resistance: +2% for Infantry units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +4 for Cavalry, Bear Cavalry, Sleds and Monster units
	(Lord's army)

Physical Resistance: +4% for Infantry units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +6 for Cavalry, Bear Cavalry, Sleds and Monster units
	(Lord's army)

Physical Resistance: +6% for Infantry units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +8 for Cavalry, Bear Cavalry, Sleds and Monster units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Most Kislevites are used to walk and ride days on puruit of roaming Chaos warbands and other invaders.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: This one's loyalty is to the crown of Kislev and its current wearer, without question, and to the bitter end, if such sacrifice is necessary.
The sacred beasts of Kislev must only be killed by the strength of one's hand or the flight of an arrow.

effects.description:
Experience gain for units: +15% when fighting against the Forces of Chaos
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: A life lived hand-in-hand with nature means that, when this one calls upon the trees, they answer his request.

effects.description:
Passive ability: "Regeneration" for embedded Hag Witch Heroes
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

skillTree.localised_description: When the God of Nature makes a ruling, the whole of the natural world stands behind him. All verdicts are final.
The enemies of Kislev shall never see Ursun's men coming until it is far, far too late.

effects.description:
Reload time reduction: +10% for Horse Archers and Akshina Ambushers units
	(Lord's army)

"Falcon Fletched" ammunition (anti-infantry) for Horse Archer units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: He knows the lands, its rivers, its streams; the best spots to defend, the best places to strike.
Never forget where you come from, especially if you wish the peasants to fight for you when war comes to Kislev.

effects.description:
Leadership: +10 for Kossars, Kislevite Warriors and Kossovite Dervishes units
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: -8% for Kossars, Kislevite Warriors and Kossovite Dervishes units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The God of Nature is fiercely protective of his domain. Only the foolish provoke his wrath.

effects.description: Ability number of uses: +1 for "Taal's Judgement"

skillTree.localised_description: When everything else fails, there is always studying the blade. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
Wielding the shield is better than returning on it. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Although precision in missile combat is something that can be learned, this one was born with a high degree of natural talent.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
Don't go into the woods today. No, seriously, don't.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
Only the foolish go on the hunt without supplies and a cast-iron plan.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Again, again, again! We'll practice this until your fingers bleed!"

effects.description:
Melee defence: +4 for Kossars, Armoured Kossars, Kislevite Warriors, Streltsi and Akshina Ambushers units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +3% for Kossars, Armoured Kossars, Streltsi and Akshina Ambushers units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Kossars, Armoured Kossars, Kislevite Warriors, Streltsi and Akshina Ambushers units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +6% for Kossars, Armoured Kossars, Streltsi and Akshina Ambushers units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +8 for Kossars, Armoured Kossars, Kislevite Warriors, Streltsi and Akshina Ambushers units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +9% for Kossars, Armoured Kossars, Streltsi and Akshina Ambushers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "There's ice in the veins of the mighty Guards of Kislev, or so the rumour goes…"

effects.description:
Melee defence: +4 for Tzar Guard and Ice Guard units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Tzar Guard units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Tzar Guard and Ice Guard units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +5% for Ice Guard units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Tzar Guard units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +8 for Tzar Guard and Ice Guard units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +7% for Ice Guard units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The thunderous pounding of Kislevite hooves can be heard for leagues around, even muffled by the crunch of fresh snow.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +12% for Kossovite Dervishes, Winged Lancers and Gryphon Legion units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +8% for Horse Archers, Kossovite Dervishes, Winged Lancers and Gryphon Legion units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12% for Kossovite Dervishes, Winged Lancers and Gryphon Legion units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +6% for Horse Archers units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +12% for Horse Archers, Kossovite Dervishes, Winged Lancers and Gryphon Legion units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +18% for Kossovite Dervishes, Winged Lancers and Gryphon Legion units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +8% for Horse Archers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The beasts that roam the forests of Kislev are somehow even more lethal than the land they inhabit.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Snow Leopard, War Bear Riders, Elemental Bear, Spider, Fell Bats, Feral Bears, Things in the Woods, Frost Wyrm and Incarnate Elemental of Beasts units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Snow Leopard, War Bear Riders, Elemental Bear, Spider, Fell Bats, Feral Bears, Things in the Woods, Frost Wyrm and Incarnate Elemental of Beasts units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +7% for Snow Leopard, War Bear Riders, Elemental Bear, Spider, Fell Bats, Feral Bears, Things in the Woods, Frost Wyrm and Incarnate Elemental of Beasts units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +8 for Snow Leopard, War Bear Riders, Elemental Bear, Spider, Fell Bats, Feral Bears, Things in the Woods, Frost Wyrm and Incarnate Elemental of Beasts units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +10% for Snow Leopard, War Bear Riders, Elemental Bear, Spider, Fell Bats, Feral Bears, Things in the Woods, Frost Wyrm and Incarnate Elemental of Beasts units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Kislevite craftsmen toil night and day, tinkering with contraptions to help repel the forces of Chaos.

effects.description:
Armour: +8 for War Sleds and Little Grom units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +10 for War Sleds and Little Grom units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +10% for War Sleds and Little Grom units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +12 for War Sleds and Little Grom units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +20% for War Sleds and Little Grom units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The warriors of the north carry conflict in their blood, a legacy left by the Khan-Kings and Khan-Queens of old.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Kossars, Armoured Kossars, Kislevite Warriors, Streltsi, Akshina Ambushers and Ice Guard units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +15% for Kossars, Armoured Kossars, Streltsi, Akshina Ambushers and Ice Guard units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 10% for Kossars, Armoured Kossars, Kislevite Warriors, Streltsi, Akshina Ambushers and Ice Guard units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Descended of the proud horse-warriors of the Gospodar, all Kislevites are born to the saddle like their ancestors before them.

effects.description:
Speed: +10% for Kossovite Dervishes, Horse Archers, Winged Lancers, and Gryphon Legion units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Kossovite Dervishes, Horse Archers, Winged Lancers, and Gryphon Legion units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Kossovite Dervishes, Horse Archers, Winged Lancers, and Gryphon Legion units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Ursun is with us, brothers! None can stand against the beasts of the Bear-God!"

effects.description:
Armour: +10 for War Bear Riders, Elemental Bear, Snow Leopard, Spider, Fell Bats, Feral Bears, Tzar Guard units, Things in the Woods, Frost Wyrm and Incarnate Elemental of Beasts (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for War Bear Riders, Elemental Bears, Snow Leopard, Spider, Fell Bats, Feral Bears, Tzar Guard, Things in the Woods, Frost Wyrm and Incarnate Elemental of Beasts units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Spell resistance: 15% for War Bear Riders, Elemental Bears, Snow Leopard, Spider, Fell Bats, Feral Bears, Tzar Guard, Things in the Woods, Frost Wyrm and Incarnate Elemental of Beasts units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The workshops of the north are always busy, their engineers working tirelessly in the pursuit of battle excellence.

effects.description:
Ammunition: +20% for War Sleds and Little Grom units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +10% for War Sleds and Little Grom units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for War Sleds and Little Grom units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Revered by the masses, such a celebrated leader will inspire many new recruits.
The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit can pass through trees.
This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.
Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description:
Ambush success chance: +10%
	(armies in local owned region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight… or when trying to get away afterwards!

related_attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Sharp minds make sharp blades sharper still.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +5% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.localised_description: What this being doesn't know probably isn't worth knowing, so deep is their interest in the world and its ways.
This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.
Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
If you can swing, slash, stab, gouge, or shoot it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +15%

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Some men are natural leaders, born to foster and marshal their tribes through devastating wars and the harshest of winters.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 when in own territory
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: For those used to life in the oblasts, keeping the elements out is only the beginning of the measures they must take to ensure the survival of their people.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +5 when in own territory
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: This valorous warrior has been at the forefront of the struggle against Ruin before, and they certainly shall be again, steeled and girded by that dreadful experience.

effects.description:
Leadership: +4 when fighting against Warriors of Chaos, Daemons of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs and Norsca
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: By right of his storied experience, this one is trusted to make sound judgements in the best interests of the Motherland.
The ancient Khan-Queen Miska practised Ice Magic to the very highest grade; this one studies her methods in the hope of attaining similar greatness.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

nodes.localised_description: His knowledge of the forest and its inhabitants give this one a better understanding than most of how they can be fielded in its defence.

effects.description:
Reload time reduction: +10% for Horse Archers and Akshina Ambushers units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +8 for Giant Spiders, Fell Bats, Spider Hatchlings, and Feral Bear units
	(Lord's army)
